verses.verse: These thynges haue I sayde vnto you, because ye shoulde not be offended.
They shall excomunitate you: yea the time shall come, that who so euer kylleth you, wyll thynke that he doth God seruice.
And such thynges wyll they do vnto you, because they haue not knowen the father, neither yet me.
But these thynges haue I tolde you, that when the tyme is come, ye may remeber then that I tolde you. These thynges sayde I not vnto you at the begynnyng, because I was present with you.
But nowe I go my waye, to hym that sent me, & none of you asketh me, whyther goest thou.
But because I haue saide such thinges vnto you, your heartes are ful of sorow.
Neuerthelesse, I tell you the trueth, it is expedient for you that I go away. For yf I go not away, that comforter wyll not come vnto you: But yf I depart, I wyll sende hym vnto you.
And whe he is come, he wyll rebuke the world of sinne, and of righteousnes, and of iudgement.
Of sinne, because they beleue not on me.
Of righteousnes, because I go to my father, and ye shall see me no more.
Of iudgement, because the prince of this worlde is iudged [alredy.]
I haue yet many thynges to say vnto you, but ye can not beare them away nowe.

Howebeit, when he is come, whiche is the spirite of trueth, he wyl leade you into all trueth. He shall not speake of himselfe: but whatsoeuer he shal heare, that shall he speake, and he wyll shewe you thynges to come.
He shall glorifie me: For he shall receaue of mine, and shal shewe vnto you.
All thynges that the father hath, are mine: Therfore sayde I [vnto you] that he shall take of mine, & shew vnto you.
After a whyle, and ye shall not see me, and agayne after a whyle ye shall see me: for I go to the father.
Then sayde some of his disciples betwene them selues: What is this that he saith vnto vs, after a whyle, & ye shal not see me, and againe, after a whyle ye shal see me: and, that I go to the father
They sayde therefore: What is this that he saith, after a whyle we can not tell what he saith.
Iesus perceaued that they would aske hym, and sayde vnto them: Do ye enquire among your selues of that I said after a whyle, and, ye shall not see me, & againe, after a while & ye shall see me
Ueryly veryly I say vnto you, ye shall wepe and lament, the worlde shall reioyce: ye shall sorowe, but your sorowe shalbe turned to ioy.
A woman, when she trauayleth, hath sorowe, because her houre is come: but assoone as she is deliuered of the childe, she remembreth no more the anguishe, for ioy that a man is borne into ye world.
And ye nowe therefore haue sorowe: but I wyll see you agayne, and your heartes shall reioyce, and your ioy shall no man take from you.
And in that day shall ye aske me no question. Ueryly veryly I say vnto you, whatsoeuer ye shal aske the father in my name, he wyll geue it you.
Hytherto haue ye asked nothyng in my name: Aske, & ye shall receaue, that your ioy may be full.
These thynges haue I spoken vnto you by prouerbes. The tyme wyl come, when I shall no more speake vnto you by prouerbes: but I shall shewe you playnely of my father.
At that day shall ye aske in my name: And I say not vnto you, that I wyll pray vnto my father for you.
For the father hym selfe loueth you, because ye haue loued me, and haue beleued that I came out from God.
I went out from the father, and came into the worlde: Agayne, I leaue the worlde, and go to the father.
His disciples sayde vnto hym: Lo, nowe talkest thou plainely, and speakest no prouerbe.
Nowe are we sure that thou knowest all thynges, & nedest not, that any man shoulde aske thee [any question:] Therfore beleue we, that thou camest from God.
Iesus aunswered them: Do ye nowe beleue
Beholde, the houre draweth nye, and is alredy come, that ye shalbe scattered euery man to his owne, and shall leaue me alone. And yet am I not alone: For the father is with me.
These wordes haue I spoken vnto you, that in me ye myght haue peace. For in the worlde shall ye haue tribulation: but be of good cheare, I haue ouercome the worlde.
